Summary: A user is able to send POST request to /hash with incorrect parameters
Actual Result: 200 OK and a job id is generated (3) and a hash was also created as a result (z4PhNX7vuL3xVChQ1m2AB9Yg5AULVxXcg/SpIdNs6c5H0NE8XYXysP+DGNKHfuwvY7kxvUdBeoGlODJ6+SfaPg==)
Notes: For this test I used username instead of password but the software treated it as though it were a password and hashed it instead of rejecting it.

Summary: A user is able to send POST request to /stats
Notes: I’m expecting the service to outright reject a POST request to this endpoint. Currently it’s treating it as though it’s a GET request.

Summary: The software is not doing a graceful shutdown as according to the acceptance criteria provided. The software should reject any new requests while the shutdown is pending.
Steps to Reproduce:
1. xargs -I % -P 10 curl --location --request POST 'localhost:8088/hash' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-raw '{"password":"Testing123"}' < <(printf '%s\n' {1..400})
2. curl -X POST -d 'shutdown' http://localhost:8088/hash
Expected Result: 200 OK, software allows any in-flight hashing to complete, software rejects any new requests
Notes: The software is continuing to accept new requests while it is pending shutdown. If the requests are a bit slower (2s) it does have time to shutdown properly.
